item.title: Mining Timers + Operator Trouble
item.dc:creator: @Slave_Scyth Slave Scyth
item.description:
@Slave_Scyth wrote:

		if ((itemUsed == 946) && (useWith = 1511)) {
			deleteItem(1511, 28);
			addItem(52, 420);
		}

Change the useWith = 1511 to useWith == 1511. = is an assignment operator, not a comparison.

As for the lowering the time, just lower those numbers I’m guessing. Never messed with mining timers, but it looks like that is the array that a random time is chosen from. You lower the time on all of them, you lower the time it takes.

Read full topic

item.title: Mining Timers + Operator Trouble
item.dc:creator: @airborne airborne
item.description:
@airborne wrote:

#1 Operator:

client.java:8614: operator && cannot be applied to boolean,int if ((itemUsed == 946) && (useWith = 1511)) { ^ Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details. 1 error Finished! Press any key to continue . . .

I get this error adding this:

if ((itemUsed == 946) && (useWith = 1511)) { deleteItem(1511, 28); addItem(52, 420); }
Help please

#2 Mining Timers

I take forever to mine in my server
This is the code:

// iron rock mining[0] = 3; mining[1] = 15; mining[2] = 35; mining[4] = 440; break;
What would I change to lower the time to mine?

Thanks.

Read full topic
